title: Opawz Permanent Dog Hair Dye, Pet Hair Dye Safely Used by Grooming Salons for a Decade, Pet Safe Dye Lasts Over 20 Washes, Bright Color for Dogs and Horses (Super Black)

features: Wanna a true black color? OPAWZ Super Black dog hair dye rocks it! AMMONIA-FREE! OPAWZ pet hair dye is safe for pets with Ammonia-free formula. PROFESSIONAL USE ONLY. Long-lasting permanent color specially formulated for dog and horse. Provides bright, fashionable and unique color results.

Dog Hair Dye Directions: 1. Shampoo well and blow-dry. 2. Mix No.1 with No. 2 with a ratio of 1:1, making sure they are thoroughly mixed. 3. Apply the mixture on the coat and leave for 20-30 minutes. 4. Rinse well and dry after.

Tip: The paste is milky white after mixing dog hair dye, and will gradually turn black with oxidation. You can apply the paste immediately after mixing No.1 & No. 2. If you wait too long and the paste has turned black, the final coloring result will not be as deep and dark as the sample photos.

Note: 1. Be sure to stir dog fur dye well with a brush before use. 2. For coloring limited areas, such as ears or tails, you may apply to dry fur. 3. Results may vary depending on application strength and individual pet’s coat. 4. Coloring results may vary with coat type and breed. 5. Results may vary depending on application strength and individual pet’s coat. 6. Coloring results may vary with coat type and breed. 7. Safe for pets over 6 months old.

CAUTION: Don't use on: pets under 6 months; cats; pets with sensitive, irritated, or damaged skin. Use Isolation cream on areas where you don't want dyed, such as ears and tail. Avoid contact with eyes and mouth. If it happens, rinse with a large amount of water for 15 minutes. If any allergic reactions happen during dyeing, discontinue immediately and consult a veterinarian. If the pet is being colored for the first time, conduct an allergy test on the skin 48 hours prior to application.
